result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:13 PM Mason Lee Hutter appeared in court, incustody via VC, Atty Liesl Nelson appears by phone,  ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF131 and 21CM49 (RW). Court questions non-appearance, he does not have a DL or phone at this time. DE is eligible for the PD. Court will quash the warrant and reinstate the bonds in both cases. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:20 pm.

1:41 PM Defendant Mason Lee Hutter does not appear in Court,  ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF131, 21CM49, 22TR551, 22TR558, 22TR1095 and 22TR1096 (STC). Due to non-appearance ADA Walker is asking for a Default on 22TR551 (Dismiss), 22TR558, 22TR1095 and 22TR1096 (Dismiss) and asking for a Statewide warrant on 22CM149 and Extradite Adj. States on 22CF131. Court will authorize warrants as requested. Court will enter a NC plea on 22TR558 and 22TR1095 with a fine of $1,019.00 days 7 mo. rev and IID for 1 year and AODA 60 daysto pay. Court will dismiss 22TR551 and 22TR1096. Court adjourned at 1:46 pm.

8:32 AM  ADA Kaley Walker in Court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mason Lee Hutter in Court pro se.  Includes 22CF131, 21CM49, 22TR551, 22TR558, 22TR1095, 22TR1096.  Defendant is unsure if he wants an attorney.  Court questions Defendant regarding counsel, he does not believe he qualifies for PD.  Court reiterates right to counsel.  Defendant states he was given offer and would like a continuance to consider.  ADA Walker requests Status in front of Judge noting two prior county appointed attorneys and prior continuances. 
 Court will set with Court Commissioner but advises Defendant that he needs to have either completed county appointed paperwork (well ahead of hearing) or have retained counsel so further scheduling may be done.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
2:30 PM Mason Lee Hutter appears in Court. ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleas not guilty to all counts. Court adjourned at 2:47 pm.

2:30 PM Mason Lee Hutter appears in Court. ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF131 (PH), 21CM49 (STC), 22TR558, 22TR1095 and 22TR1096 (IN). DE would like to represent himself for all cases. State calls Dep. Luke Schladweiler. S/T. ADA Walker questions Deputy. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Mr. Hutter. ADA Walker is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over.  Court adjourned at 2:47 pm.
Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:33 PM (NCR) Defendant Mason Lee Hutter appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF131 (PH) and 21CM49 (STC). DE submitted a request to appear by phone because he is ill. Court addresses time limits with DE and he wishes to waive time limits. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH. DE will need to submit a PFAC as soon as possible. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:38 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
NO CONTACT WITH THE WOODSHED

03:27 PM Defendant Mason Lee Hutter appears via videoconferencing from PCJ with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Mason Lee Hutter in custody.  ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return on warrant in 22CM137 and Initial on 22CF131.  Court addresses non-appearance on 22CM137.  Atty. Nelson advises that Defendant had Atty. Melissa Petersen and did not believe he needed to appear.  Notes she was allowed to withdraw.  Court quashes warrant and reinstates signature bond on 22CM137.  Court addresses Initial Appearance on 22CF131.  Court advises of charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives further reading.  Court advises of constitutional rights.  State requests $250.00 cash bond with condition of no contact with Woodshed in Trenton township, states argument.  Atty. Nelson notes limited income and requests signature bond.  Defendant makes statement re: missed appearance.  Court orders $10,000 signature bond w/condition requested.  Court advises of right to speedy preliminary hearing.  Defendant understands and requests.  Attorneys request Status on both cases to see if Defendant will have counsel.  Court confirms Defendant's address, phone and dob.  Attorneys request Status be changed to PH due to no waiver.  Adjourned at 3:37 PM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
